features_implemented: Home Page with hero section, featured areas (Climate Change, Wildlife Protection, Sustainable Living), call-to-action buttons, and statistics section
About Page with mission statement, 6 core values cards, and 6 environmental goals
Initiatives Page with 10 environmental initiatives, category filtering (All, Climate, Wildlife, Ocean, Recycling), and responsive grid layout
Articles/Knowledge Page with list of 6 educational articles showing title, summary, and publish date
Article Detail Page with full content, navigation between articles, and call-to-action section
Get Involved Page with volunteer sign-up form including name, email, area of interest dropdown
Contact Page with contact form (name, email, message) and contact information display
Form validation for required fields and email format on both Get Involved and Contact pages
Success messages displayed after form submission
Responsive navigation header with mobile hamburger menu
Footer with quick links, social media icons, and copyright information
React Router configuration with 7 routes including dynamic article detail routes
Fully typed TypeScript interfaces for Initiative, Article, VolunteerFormData, ContactFormData
Mock data stored locally in data/ folder with initiatives.ts and articles.ts
Responsive design with mobile-first approach using Tailwind breakpoints (sm, md, lg)
Reusable Button component with variants (primary, secondary, outline) and sizes
Reusable Card component with optional hover effects
Custom eco-friendly color palette (earth and ocean colors) in Tailwind config
Accessibility features including semantic HTML, ARIA labels, and keyboard navigation
All data structures properly typed with TypeScript strict mode enabled
notes: Complete implementation of GreenEarth environmental protection website according to specification. All required pages, features, and interactions have been implemented with full TypeScript typing, responsive design, and accessibility considerations. The project uses React 18+, Vite, Tailwind CSS, and React Router as specified. Mock data is provided for initiatives and articles. Forms include proper validation with success messages. The application is ready to run with 'pnpm install && pnpm dev'. No use of 'any' type - all components and data structures are properly typed with TypeScript strict mode enabled. Responsive design tested for mobile, tablet, and desktop breakpoints. The color palette uses custom earth (green) and ocean (blue) colors fitting the environmental theme.
